titleStmt.title: Cambridge, Massachusetts, Harvard Houghton Library, MS R

msItem.title: Magna carta with statutes, vetera and nova, to 8 Edward IV.

history.provenance: Provenance: Mede family of Bristol [?]; David Daxon; James Dyer, 1562; sold in estate sale of Arthur Thomass Liddell, baron Ravensworth, 1919; Owen D. Young; bequest of William King Richardson.

listBibl.bibl: Bibliography: De Ricci, p. 1854; ELMUSA, p. 39; Stephanie Lahey, ‘Legal Book Collecting in Late Medieval Bristol’, thesis, Univ. of Ottawa (2015), esp. pp. 89–112; 'Directory', p. 374.

body.p:
Cambridge, Massachusetts, Harvard Houghton Library
MS Richardson 40. Magna carta with statutes, vetera and nova, to 8 Edward IV. 478 ff. in 3 vols. 310 x 210 mm.
Provenance: Mede family of Bristol [?]; David Daxon; James Dyer, 1562; sold in estate sale of Arthur Thomass Liddell, baron Ravensworth, 1919; Owen D. Young; bequest of William King Richardson.
Bibliography: De Ricci, p. 1854; ELMUSA, p. 39; Stephanie Lahey, ‘Legal Book Collecting in Late Medieval Bristol’, thesis, Univ. of Ottawa (2015), esp. pp. 89–112; 'Directory', p. 374.
